intro: Darcya costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican darcya, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
